conclusion: Analyze currents and forces on the triangular conductor frame in a magnetic field.
Triangle ABC is made of uniform resistance wires, with points A and B connected to a voltage source.
There is a potential difference between A and B, causing current to flow.
Current will flow from A to B, splitting equally between paths ACB and AB.
Current through AC and CB is I/2 each; current through AB is I.
Ampere force on a wire segment is given by F = IBL.
Force on AB is F; force on AC and CB is F/2 each.
Force on AC acts at 60° to the horizontal; force on CB acts at 60° in the opposite direction.
Vertical components of forces on AC and CB cancel each other.
Horizontal components add up to give a total horizontal force of F.
Resultant Ampere force on the three wires is 2F.
